website_summaries.verdict: The Asics DynaFlyte is gaining momentum when it comes to the comfort and efficacy of the wearer. This neutral shoe gives responsive cushioning that’s going to feel like nothing when taken to the races or daily running sessions. A striking look certainly adds to the appeal of this running shoe.
pros: The upper unit uses high quality fabrics in order to provide a secure and comfortable coverage
Irritation-free wearing is part of what the upper unit provides, so runners were happy with it
Runners were appreciative of the anti-microbial and anti-moisture sock liner
Asics offers many color schemes when it comes to their shoes and the Asics DynaFlyte is no exception
Landing impact is handled by the comfortable and durable platform
A very lightweight mid-sole foam offers continuous cushioning and support that’s very easy on the foot
Durable carbon rubber in the outsole unit protects the shoe from abrasion
cons: This shoe is a bit expensive

customer_reviews.title: Excellent running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Excellent running shoes! I needed something for the gym and these fit the bill perfectly. I have quite a wide foot and these are wide enough to allow my feet to spread without restriction. The cushioning on these is phenomenal, it feels like you're running on memory foam. I also bought the New Balance Zante V3 and these were far more comfortable, so the Zante went back.
customer_reviews.author: M. Owen

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these, they make a great addition to my Gel Cumulus. They are slightly tight in the toe box when your feet are just a bit wider, but to me they are still comfortable. I have not been able to experience the heating up of your feet that I've read about. Though I have been staying in the 5k-10k range.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Good quality runners
customer_reviews.text: I've not worn them for a long run yet, but they've proven to be really good for the 5K runs I've used them on. They are well cushioned and comfortable, and have enough room for my feet to expand into when they get a little warm. They're also fairly breathable, which is a bit of a drawback if wet, but then I'd rather my feet be able to breathe, and these aren't meant for trail. All in all, a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gethin Down

customer_reviews.title: Good trainer, lots of shock absorbing.
customer_reviews.text: Nice trainer, very soft (that being a positive for me because I'm only just starting out). Seems to have enough support in the right places. Generally very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Topcat

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, comfortable shoe for a steady 10k run on ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, comfortable shoe for a steady 10k run on a track or road run. With a decent grip and just enough cushioning running in these a couple of times a week has become less painful. Only four stars due to the expense.
customer_reviews.author: MR LEOLedge

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes that I have bought in a while
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoes that I have bought in a while. Very soft sole and perfect if you are a fast runner that pounds the earth
customer_reviews.author: Black

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good support and comfortable ,I am running on thread mill ,not sure how it performs outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Darius Tabrizi

customer_reviews.title: Hmmm...
customer_reviews.text: Poor insole. Average running shoe in my eyes. I expected more!!
customer_reviews.author: L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. 15 Mile first outing and was great
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. 15 Mile first outing and was great. Very light and perfect fit. Having checked though the price was £3 more than on actual Asics website which was frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keep on running
customer_reviews.text: Good neutral running shoe. Some level of water resistance. Would recommend for distance runners
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fantastic bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: had gel nimbus before but these are just as comfy great to run in and very fast recorded my fastest 10k on my first time wearing them
customer_reviews.author: Ian Woodgate

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and fast
customer_reviews.text: Feel like fast shoes. Some running underneath left big toe but hope that fades
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good product. Only used a couple of runs so far but comfy so far
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to this shoe considering the hype surrounding it. However, not only was I disappointed in the flytefoam cushioning, but also the upper just does not breath. My feet were cooked after just a mile of running.
customer_reviews.author: D. Angell

product_meta.title: ASICS Men's Dynaflyte Competition Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Asics Dynaflyte Running Shoes The Dynaflyte is your entry to the fast category. Packed with GEL cushioning in the rear foot to cushion every step without adding weight. The Dynaflyte features an Impact Guidance System (IGS) to match your natural movements and anatomy. 3M reflectivity keeps you visible in low light conditions and thanks to the guidance line your foot is given complete support and guidance from the first impact to push-off. Breathable Mesh Upper The breathable mesh upper of the Dynaflyte works to keep your feet cool and comfortable by actively and efficiently wicking away the build-up of excess sweat and moisture. Once the sweat and moisture have been wicked, it is then transported from your skin to remove any distraction or discomfort that may hamper your performance. A ComforDry X-40 Sockliner features higher rebound properties while providing excellent moisture management and high-level breathability. The sockliner also guards against irritation such as chafing to deliver a more comfortable feel as you clock up the miles. 3M reflective material improves safety and visibility in low light conditions such as early morning or evening runs when the light is at a premium. The reflectivity also makes you visible to passing vehicles. FlyteFoam Midsole FlyteFoam technology is remarkably 55% lighter than the industry standard. Whilst midsole constructed with FlyteFoam tech isn't just super lightweight, it benefits from organic super fibres that bounce back into their original shape in the space of each stride, providing you with perfect adaptive cushioning from the start of your run to the finish. This engineered resilience also makes midsoles with FlyteFoam technology far more durable than their predecessors, so your body benefits not only from an elite level of cushioning, but elite cushioning that will perform at its peak longer and stronger than ever before. Additionally, the Dynaflyte wouldn't be the same if it didn't have the gel that sit
feature_bullets: Breathable Mesh Upper - Keeps you ventilated and comfortable.
Moisture Management - Wicks away excess sweat and moisture.
ComfortDry X-40 Sockliner - Adds comfort and guards against chafing.
3M Reflective - Improves safety and visibility in low light conditions.
FlyteFoam Midsole - Provides lightweight, comfortable and durable cushioning.
